description: From the opening of an observatory dome, an adult figure points to a constellation in the dark night sky while a child figure looks on. The stars in the sky form a specific, non-standard shape resembling a person performing a headfirst dip or dive. The humor arises from the literal and absurd visual representation of a constellation named "The Big Dip," contrasting with the expected, more abstract astronomical forms. This presents an ironic twist on the act of learning about constellations by interpreting their names directly and visually.
caption: Now that constellation, Jimmy, is simply called ‘The Big Dip.’”
